get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of all prompts in the system. A prompt can have multiple versions.

parameters.name: cursor

schema.description: Cursor for pagination (base64-encoded prompt ID)
schema.title: Cursor

parameters.description: Cursor for pagination (base64-encoded prompt ID)

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: The max number of prompts to return at a time.
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: The max number of prompts to return at a time.

200.description: A list of prompts with pagination information

post.description: Create a new prompt and its initial version. A prompt can have multiple versions.

get.description: Retrieve all versions of a specific prompt with pagination support. Each prompt can have multiple versions with different configurations.

parameters.name: prompt_identifier

schema.description: The identifier of the prompt, i.e. name or ID.
schema.title: Prompt Identifier

parameters.description: The identifier of the prompt, i.e. name or ID.

parameters.name: cursor

schema.description: Cursor for pagination (base64-encoded promptVersion ID)
schema.title: Cursor

parameters.description: Cursor for pagination (base64-encoded promptVersion ID)

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: The max number of prompt versions to return at a time.
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: The max number of prompt versions to return at a time.

200.description: A list of prompt versions with pagination information

get.description: Retrieve a specific prompt version using its unique identifier. A prompt version contains the actual template and configuration.

parameters.name: prompt_version_id

schema.description: The ID of the prompt version.
schema.title: Prompt Version Id

parameters.description: The ID of the prompt version.

get.description: Retrieve a specific prompt version using its tag name. Tags are used to identify specific versions of a prompt.

parameters.name: prompt_identifier

schema.description: The identifier of the prompt, i.e. name or ID.
schema.title: Prompt Identifier

parameters.description: The identifier of the prompt, i.e. name or ID.

parameters.name: tag_name

schema.description: The tag of the prompt version
schema.title: Tag Name

parameters.description: The tag of the prompt version

200.description: The prompt version with the specified tag

get.description: Retrieve the most recent version of a specific prompt.

parameters.name: prompt_identifier

schema.description: The identifier of the prompt, i.e. name or ID.
schema.title: Prompt Identifier

parameters.description: The identifier of the prompt, i.e. name or ID.

200.description: The latest version of the specified prompt

get.description: Retrieve all tags associated with a specific prompt version. Tags are used to identify and categorize different versions of a prompt.

parameters.name: prompt_version_id

schema.description: The ID of the prompt version.
schema.title: Prompt Version Id

parameters.description: The ID of the prompt version.

parameters.name: cursor

schema.description: Cursor for pagination (base64-encoded promptVersionTag ID)
schema.title: Cursor

parameters.description: Cursor for pagination (base64-encoded promptVersionTag ID)

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: The max number of tags to return at a time.
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: The max number of tags to return at a time.

200.description: A list of tags associated with the prompt version

post.description: Add a new tag to a specific prompt version. Tags help identify and categorize different versions of a prompt.

parameters.name: prompt_version_id

schema.description: The ID of the prompt version.
schema.title: Prompt Version Id

parameters.description: The ID of the prompt version.

204.description: No content returned on successful tag creation

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of all projects in the system.

parameters.name: cursor

schema.description: Cursor for pagination (project ID)
schema.title: Cursor

parameters.description: Cursor for pagination (project ID)

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: The max number of projects to return at a time.
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: The max number of projects to return at a time.

parameters.name: include_experiment_projects

schema.description: Include experiment projects in the response. Experiment projects are created from running experiments.
schema.title: Include Experiment Projects

parameters.description: Include experiment projects in the response. Experiment projects are created from running experiments.

200.description: A list of projects with pagination information

post.description: Create a new project with the specified configuration.

get.summary: Get project by ID or name
get.description: Retrieve a specific project using its unique identifier: either project ID or project name. Note: When using a project name as the identifier, it cannot contain slash (/), question mark (?), or pound sign (#) characters.

parameters.name: project_identifier

schema.description: The project identifier: either project ID or project name. If using a project name, it cannot contain slash (/), question mark (?), or pound sign (#) characters.
schema.title: Project Identifier

parameters.description: The project identifier: either project ID or project name. If using a project name, it cannot contain slash (/), question mark (?), or pound sign (#) characters.

put.summary: Update a project by ID or name
put.description: Update an existing project with new configuration. Project names cannot be changed. The project identifier is either project ID or project name. Note: When using a project name as the identifier, it cannot contain slash (/), question mark (?), or pound sign (#) characters.

parameters.name: project_identifier

schema.description: The project identifier: either project ID or project name. If using a project name, it cannot contain slash (/), question mark (?), or pound sign (#) characters.
schema.title: Project Identifier

parameters.description: The project identifier: either project ID or project name. If using a project name, it cannot contain slash (/), question mark (?), or pound sign (#) characters.

delete.summary: Delete a project by ID or name
delete.description: Delete an existing project and all its associated data. The project identifier is either project ID or project name. The default project cannot be deleted. Note: When using a project name as the identifier, it cannot contain slash (/), question mark (?), or pound sign (#) characters.

parameters.name: project_identifier

schema.description: The project identifier: either project ID or project name. If using a project name, it cannot contain slash (/), question mark (?), or pound sign (#) characters.
schema.title: Project Identifier

parameters.description: The project identifier: either project ID or project name. If using a project name, it cannot contain slash (/), question mark (?), or pound sign (#) characters.

204.description: No content returned on successful deletion

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the experiment (if omitted, a random name will be generated)

description.description: An optional description of the experiment

version_id.description: ID of the dataset version over which the experiment will be run (if omitted, the latest version will be used)

repetitions.description: Number of times the experiment should be repeated for each example

dataset_example_id.description: The ID of the dataset example used in the experiment run

output.description: The output of the experiment task

repetition_number.title: Repetition Number
repetition_number.description: The repetition number of the experiment run

end_time.description: The end time of the experiment run

trace_id.title: Trace Id
trace_id.description: The ID of the corresponding trace (if one exists)

error.description: Optional error message if the experiment run encountered an error
